content.question: An RC circuit consists of a resistor with resistance of <math alttext="R equals 100 kilo ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>k</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> , a battery with <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="100 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> , and two capacitors with capacitances of <math alttext="C sub 1 equals 20 microfarads" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μ</mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C sub 2 equals 60 microfarads" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μ</mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Initially the capacitors are uncharged, and then the switch is closed at <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
